security_audit.summary: This is a documentation and guide skill for MCP server development. It contains no executable code, no network operations, no file system access beyond reading documentation files, and no external commands. The skill provides comprehensive guides, best practices, and an evaluation framework for building MCP servers safely.

content.user_title: Build MCP Servers with Best Practices
content.value_statement: Create secure, efficient MCP servers that enable AI agents to interact with external APIs and services. Follow proven patterns for tool design, error handling, and evaluation.
actual_capabilities: Guides building MCP servers in Python and TypeScript
Provides complete implementation examples with code
Includes evaluation framework for testing MCP servers
Offers security and best practice guidelines
Supports multiple transport types (stdio, HTTP, SSE)
limitations: Requires programming knowledge to implement servers
External API integration needs proper authentication
Evaluation testing needs Claude API access

prompt_templates.title: Basic MCP Server
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a basic MCP server in Python that can search for users in our internal system. Follow the best practices from the guide, including proper tool naming, input validation with Pydantic, and error handling.

prompt_templates.title: API Integration
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to build an MCP server that integrates with GitHub API. Show me how to implement tools for searching repositories, creating issues, and managing pull requests with proper authentication and rate limiting.

prompt_templates.title: Evaluation Testing
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an evaluation test suite for my MCP server that tests whether Claude can effectively use the tools to answer complex questions. Include 10 realistic test cases following the evaluation guidelines.

prompt_templates.title: Production Deployment
prompt_templates.prompt: Guide me through deploying an MCP server in production with proper security measures, including OAuth authentication, input validation, error handling, and monitoring best practices.

output_examples.input: Create an MCP server for Slack integration
output: Tools for sending messages, listing channels, and searching users
Proper error handling and rate limiting
Evaluation test suite with 10 test cases

best_practices: Use service-specific prefixes in tool names to avoid conflicts
Implement both JSON and Markdown response formats for flexibility
Add proper annotations (readOnlyHint, destructiveHint) to all tools
anti_patterns: Don't create tools that simply wrap single API endpoints
Avoid returning excessive data that overwhelms the context window
Never skip input validation or error handling
Don't ignore the CHARACTER_LIMIT when returning large datasets

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: The guide covers both Python (with FastMCP) and Node/TypeScript (with MCP SDK) implementations.

faq.question: How do I test my MCP server?
faq.answer: Use the included evaluation framework with XML test cases to verify Claude can effectively use your tools.

faq.question: What transport types are available?
faq.answer: MCP supports stdio (local), HTTP (web services), and SSE (real-time) transports for different deployment scenarios.

faq.question: How do I handle authentication?
faq.answer: The guide covers OAuth 2.1, API keys, and secure credential management best practices for external service integration.

faq.question: What's the difference between tools and resources?
faq.answer: Tools are for actions and operations, while resources provide static data access via URI templates.

faq.question: How do I prevent tool name conflicts?
faq.answer: Always use service-specific prefixes like 'github_create_issue' instead of generic names like 'create_issue'.
